title: Sinigang na Baka Recipe
description: A simple Filipino beef and vegetable soup in a sour tamarind base that we eat over rice! A meal in itself!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Sinigang na Baka 4.6 (51) 36 Reviews 12 Photos Simple beef, vegetable, tamarind based soup that we eat over rice! A meal in itself! Submitted by ALLYD Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons canola oil 1 large onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, chopped 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into 1 inch cubes 1 quart water 2 large tomatoes, diced ½ pound fresh green beans, rinsed and trimmed ½ medium head bok choy, cut into 1 1/2 inch strips 1 head fresh broccoli, cut into bite size pieces 1 (1.41 ounce) package tamarind soup base Directions Heat oil in medium stock pot. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Add beef to pot, and saute until browned. Pour in water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20 to 30 minutes. Place tomatoes and green beans in pot, and continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in bok choy, broccoli and tamarind soup mix. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes. I Made It Print 82 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Sinigang na Baka 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 12 Photo by  Jessica Christine Imperial 02/08/2021 03 of 12 Photo by  Jane Rodgers 10/30/2018 Here is my pic of my beef sinagang! 04 of 12 Photo by  Koumiko 08/31/2016 05 of 12 Photo by  scollins81sc 01/09/2016 06 of 12 Photo by  Philippe Tolentino 08/13/2015 07 of 12 Photo by  Philippe Tolentino 08/13/2015 08 of 12 Photo by  Lyndon Griarte 02/07/2015 09 of 12 Photo by  jtengco25 12/12/2010 I'm Haitian and my husband is Filipino. I made this to surprise him and was he!! He loved it and so did I! The recipe is SO easy to follow, every major item is easily found in the local grocery store and it tastes great! Its perfect for a cold night. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Chinese Sizzling Rice Soup 28 Ratings Pork Sinigang 32 Ratings Red Winter Minestrone with Winter Greens Pesto Sweet Potato Minestrone 296 Ratings Cheesy Vegetable Chowder 125 Ratings Creamy Quinoa and Vegetable Soup 3 Ratings Spicy Miso Soup with Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms and Green Beans 6 Ratings Okonomiyaki 50 Ratings Classic Minestrone 290 Ratings Vegan Chunky Chili 42 Ratings Spicy and Creamy Vegetable Soup 17 Ratings Filipino Pork Adobo 38 Ratings Creamy Green Bean Soup 12 Ratings Hot Dog Soup 40 Ratings Pinakbet 26 Ratings Thịt Bò Xào Đậu (Vietnamese Stir-Fried Beef and Green Beans) 121 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: ALLYD
instructions: Heat oil in medium stock pot. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Add beef to pot, and saute until browned. Pour in water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20 to 30 minutes.;Place tomatoes and green beans in pot, and continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in bok choy, broccoli and tamarind soup mix. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
